SEARCH
Package ca.jolt.core

Class Router

java.lang.Object
ca.jolt.core.Router
public final class Router extends Object
Manages and matches routes against HTTP method/path patterns within a Jolt application. Supports the standard HTTP verbs (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE) and allows registering both RouteHandler and Supplier as route handlers. Also supports grouping routes for organization via group(String, Runnable).

Routes are stored internally and checked against incoming requests to determine the correct handler. Duplicate routes (same method and path) throw a DuplicateRouteException. This router is exposed as a bean via JoltBean so it can be injected where needed (e.g., in JoltApplication or JoltDispatcherServlet).

Since:
1.0
Author:
William

  • Method Details

    • before

      public void before(Consumer<JoltContext> handler, String... routes)
      Registers a "before" handler that applies only to the specified routes.
      Parameters:
      handler - A handler to run before each matching route. Receives a JoltContext for the current request.
      routes - One or more route paths (e.g. "/doc", "/api") where the handler applies

    • after

      public void after(Consumer<JoltContext> handler, String... routes)
      Registers an "after" handler that applies only to the specified routes.
      Parameters:
      handler - A handler to run after each matching route. Receives a JoltContext for the current request.
      routes - One or more route paths (e.g. "/doc", "/api") where the handler applies

    • get

      public void get(String path, RouteHandler handler)
      Registers a new HTTP GET route.

      The path will be normalized and combined with any active group prefixes. Both empty strings and "/" are accepted for the root path.

      Parameters:
      path - The path pattern, possibly with placeholders
      handler - A RouteHandler to process the request
      Throws:
      DuplicateRouteException - If a route with the same method and path exists

    • post

      public void post(String path, RouteHandler handler)
      Registers a new HTTP POST route.

      The path will be normalized and combined with any active group prefixes. Both empty strings and "/" are accepted for the root path.

      Parameters:
      path - The path pattern to match
      handler - A RouteHandler to process the request
      Throws:
      DuplicateRouteException - If a route with the same method and path exists

    • put

      public void put(String path, RouteHandler handler)
      Registers a new HTTP PUT route.

      The path will be normalized and combined with any active group prefixes. Both empty strings and "/" are accepted for the root path.

      Parameters:
      path - The path pattern to match
      handler - A RouteHandler to process the request
      Throws:
      DuplicateRouteException - If a route with the same method and path exists

    • delete

      public void delete(String path, RouteHandler handler)
      Registers a new HTTP DELETE route.

      The path will be normalized and combined with any active group prefixes. Both empty strings and "/" are accepted for the root path.

      Parameters:
      path - The path pattern to match
      handler - A RouteHandler to process the request
      Throws:
      DuplicateRouteException - If a route with the same method and path exists

    • route

      public void route(HttpMethod method, String path, RouteHandler handler)
      Register a new HTTP route with the specified method and path.

      The path will be normalized and combined with any active group prefixes. Both empty strings and "/" are accepted for the root path.

      Parameters:
      method - The HTTP method (e.g. GET, POST, etc.)
      path - The path pattern to match
      handler - A RouteHandler to process the request

    • group

      public void group(String prefix, Runnable group)
      Groups multiple routes under a common path prefix.

      The prefix is normalized and combined with any existing prefixes. Routes defined within the group will automatically inherit this prefix.

      Example usage: 

      
 group("/api", () -> {
     get("/users", UserController::getAll); // /api/users
     get("/", HomeController::apiIndex); // /api
     group("/admin", () -> {
         get("/dashboard", AdminController::dashboard); // /api/admin/dashboard
     });
 });
      Parameters:
      prefix - The path prefix for the grouped routes
      group - A Runnable containing route definitions

    • getAllowedMethods

      public List<String> getAllowedMethods(String path)
      Returns a list of HTTP methods allowed for the specified path.

      Useful when responding with HTTP 405, indicating which methods are valid for a certain path.

      Parameters:
      path - The request path to check
      Returns:
      A list of valid HTTP methods, or an empty list if none match

    • match

      public RouteMatch match(String method, String requestPath)
      Matches the HTTP method and path against registered routes using a Pattern. Returns a RouteMatch if successful or null if no match is found.
      Parameters:
      method - The HTTP method (e.g., "GET")
      requestPath - The request path (e.g., "/user/123")
      Returns:
      A RouteMatch if a route is matched, otherwise null
